alert.note: Alert for Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Avalanche Watch issued February 14 at 8:08AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The following message is transmitted at the request of the Taos Avalanche Center. The Taos Avalanche Center in Taos has issued a Backcountry Avalanche Watch. * WHAT...The avalanche danger is currently Considerable. Another winter storm may increase the avalanche danger to High at all elevations Wednesday, February 15, 2023. * WHERE...Wheeler Peak Wilderness Area and Columbine Hondo Wilderness above 9500 feet. * WHEN...In effect from Tue 08:00 MST to Wed 08:00 MST. * IMPACTS...Another winter storm is on tap tonight into Wednesday, February 15th where we could see an additional foot of snow and very strong winds through Wednesday. This will bring storm totals close to 2 feet of snow in the last 2 days. Large dangerous natural and human triggered avalanches are likely throughout the day Wednesday. * PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Dangerous avalanche conditions exist. Careful snowpack evaluation, cautious route finding and conservative decision-making are essential for travel in the backcountry today. This Avalanche Watch is scheduled to expire at 08:00 on February 15th. Check back with the Taos Avalanche Center to see if the Avalanche Watch is extended, or upgraded to an Avalanche Warning. Consult http://www.taosavalanchecenter.org or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
